title: Plymouth sign Wales international Simon Church
description: Simon Church has joined Plymouth Argyle on a free transfer after leaving Sky Bet League One competitors Scunthorpe United earlier this month.
content: The 28-year-old has won 38 caps for Wales and was a member of the Euro 2016 squad that reached the semi-finals.The former Reading player has scored 41 league goals in 241 career appearances and also has three international goals.Church had been linked with a move to Polish top-flight club, Lechia Gdansk - however, manager Derek Adams made sure to secure his signature for the second half of the season.Adams' side sit 13th in the League One table and are unbeaten in their last eight games.Church is Plymouth's third signing of the transfer window, after loans deals were secured for Bristol City defender Zak Vyner and Norwich goalkeeper Remi Matthews.
